analyzed: sakala jagat artha dakṣaḥ viśuddha bodhau jinaḥ jayati
translated: The one who is skilled in the welfare of the entire world, the pure-minded Jina, may he be victorious.

analyzed: yaḥ śrīmān sa sura asuraiḥ aviratam pāda aravinda arcitaḥ sākṣāt puṇya nidhāna maṅgala guruḥ cintāmaṇiḥ sarva vid
translated: He who is glorious, whose lotus feet are constantly worshipped by gods and demons, who is the very embodiment of merit, the auspicious guru, the wish-fulfilling gem, the omniscient one,

translated: The one who has completely removed the tangled net of faults, the son of Śuddhodana, the one who has gone to the other shore, may that Blessed One, the lord of sages, the Jina, shining with radiance, protect you all.

analyzed: anantaram asya avadānasya nidānam āha

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kārttika kṛṣṇa pratipadam ārabhya triṃśat divaseṣu yat ahorātram tatra saṃghasya kaṭhinam utpadyate
translated: Beginning from the first day of the dark fortnight of Kārttika, in the thirty days, on that day and night, the kaṭhina arises for the Saṅgha.

analyzed: tat sa adhivāsam ānāpayitavyam
translated: That should be brought in for approval.

original: kṛtakalpadarśārañjanā nīlasūtrasūcīśāstrakalpena tad dānapatayaḥ saṃnipatite saṃghe niḥsārāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: kṛta kalpa darśā rañjanāḥ nīlasūtra sūcī śāstra kalpena tat dānapatayaḥ saṃnipatite saṃghe niḥsārāpayitavyāḥ
translated: The donors should be made to give it to the assembled Saṅgha by the method of the Nīla Sutra Sūtra, which delights in showing the Kalpa.

original: karmakārekeṇa bikṣuṇā tato dānapatayo dānaparikarmakathāyā pratisaṃmodayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: karmakārekeṇa bikṣuṇā tatas dānapatayaḥ dāna parikarma kathāyā pratisaṃmodayitavyāḥ
translated: Then a monk who is the officiant should delight the donors in the discourse on the purification of giving.

analyzed: tat sā adhivāsā ityādi
translated: That is the place of residence, etc.

analyzed: kaṭhina pradānam karttu kāmena dānapatinā
translated: By a donor who wishes to give the thick cloth,

original: ṣaḍhe śrāvaṇe vā māse savinayam upagamya kalpikakārakasya mukhenāryasaṃghasya vijñaptiḥ karaṇīyā tena caivaṃ karaṇīyā /
analyzed: ṣaḍhe śrāvaṇe vā māse sa vinayam upagamya kalpika kārakasya mukhena ārya saṃghasya vijñaptiḥ karaṇīyā tena ca evam karaṇīyā
translated: in the month of Śrāvaṇa or Bhādrapada, having approached with humility, he should make a request to the noble Saṅgha through the one who performs the proper duties. And that one should do it thus:

analyzed: samanvāhara ārya saṃgha ayam amuka nāma kaṭhinam āstariṣyati
translated: Please consider, noble Saṅgha, this one named so-and-so will spread the thick cloth.

analyzed: yadi te ṅgīkaroti ārya saṃghaḥ no ced nivārayatu iti
translated: If the noble Saṅgha accepts, if not, please stop it.

translated: And he too, at that time, if the donor's intention is pure and the gift is pure, then he should accept it with silence, if not, he should stop it.

original: yadi tadādhivāsayatyāryasaṃghastadā supramāṇāṃ surūpāṃ yugalīṃ rañjayitvā'sya darśayet /
analyzed: yadi tadā adhivāsayati ārya saṃghaḥ tadā su pramāṇām surūpām yugalīm rañjayitvā asya darśayet
translated: If the noble Saṅgha consents at that time, then he should dye a well-measured, well-formed pair of robes and show it to him.

original: tataḥ kalpikakārakastam ādāya dānapatiṃ visṛjya hastena māpayitvānayā kaṭhinacīvaraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tatas kalpika kārakaḥ tam ādāya dānapatim visṛjya hastena māpayitvā anayā kaṭhina cīvaram kariṣyati
translated: Then the one who performs the proper duties, having taken it, having dismissed the donor, having measured it with his hand, will make this kathina robe.

analyzed: dānapatiḥ iti tasmai pratipādayet
translated: The donor should give it to him.

original: dvividhaṃ hi kaṭhinaṃ cīvaraṃ kṛtam akṛtakañca /
analyzed: dvividham hi kaṭhinam cīvaram kṛtam a kṛtakam ca
translated: For the kathina robe is of two kinds: made and unmade.

analyzed: tatra nikāya bhedena tri khaṇḍa pañca khaṇḍa ādikam pariṇāhena anyūna tri hastam āyāmena anyūna pañca hastam su sīvitam kṛtakam
translated: There, according to the sect, it is made in three or five pieces, etc., with a circumference of less than three cubits and a length of less than five cubits, well-sewn, it is made.

analyzed: a kṛta daśam a sīvitam a kṛtakam
translated: The unmade is not sewn.

original: tat punaḥ pratyekaṃ dvividhaṃ niṣṭhitam aniṣṭhitañca /
analyzed: tat punar pratyekam dvividham niṣṭhitam aniṣṭhitam ca
translated: Moreover, each is of two kinds: finished and unfinished.

analyzed: tatra kṛta nīla bindukam tat niṣṭhita kṛt
translated: There, the one with the blue spot finished, consecrated with the worship mantra, is finished.

analyzed: itarat aniṣṭhitam  atra āśvinipūrṇṇamāsyām dānapateḥ
translated: The other is unfinished.

original: ṇayā kālpikakārakaḥ /🔽siddhaṃ kaṭhinacīvaraṃ ādāyādhiṣṭhitatraimāsasyāryasaṃghasya purastād evaṃ vadet /
analyzed: ṇayā kālpika kārakaḥ  siddham kaṭhina cīvaram ādāya adhiṣṭhita traimāsasya ārya saṃghasya purastāt evam vadet
translated: Here, on the full moon of Āśvina, the one who performs the proper duties,🔽having taken the finished kathina robe, should say this in front of the noble Saṅgha who has entered the three months:

original: samanvāharāryyānena civareṇāsmiṃ saṃghāvāse'mūkanāma dānapatiḥ kaṭhinam āstariṣyati /
analyzed: samanvāhara ārya anena civareṇa asmin saṃghāvāsemūka nāma dānapatiḥ kaṭhinam āstariṣyati
translated: Pay attention, noble ones! In this monastery, the donor named so-and-so will spread the kathina with this robe.

original: adhivasatvāryasaṃghānumodayatu dānapatiriti /🔽evaṃ dvirapi trirapi tadanvāryasaṃgho'pi tad adhyeṣaṇām aṅgīkṛtya divā //
analyzed: adhivasatu ārya saṃgha anumodayatu dānapatiḥ iti  evam dvis api tris api tad anvārya saṃghaḥ api tat adhyeṣaṇām aṅgīkṛtya divā
translated: May the noble assembly consent to stay, and may the donor rejoice.

original: vā masīdravādinā nīlarāgarasena vā prānte caturbindūṃścatusatyādi viśuddhyā datvā trīn vā triratnādi visśuddhyā dvau vā yogasaṃbhārādi viśuddhyā yathā vidhānam abhi //
analyzed: vā masī drava ādinā nīlarāga rasena vā prānte catur bindūn catu satya ādi viśuddhyā da tvā trīn vā tri ratna ādi viśuddhyā dvau vā yoga saṃbhāra ādi viśuddhyā yathā vidhānam abhi
translated: Thus, twice and thrice, the noble assembly also accepts that request and, during the day or night, with ink made from cow bezoar or blue lac dye, places four drops at the edges for the purity of the four noble truths, or three for the purity of the Three Jewels, or two for the purity of the requisites of yoga, as prescribed.

analyzed: yā id etat
translated: This is it.

original: prabhātāyan tu nisāyāṃ parikalpitesūpasṛṣṭe samucchritātapatradhvajapatākā digvidig vinyastakhaṇḍapiṇḍadhūpaghaṭikojjvalayaṣṭipradīpasugandhagandhādidivyasurabhikusumāvakīrṇṇe pradeśe khaṭvāyām mañcāyām vā pṛthupīṭhake mantrādhiṣṭhitaṃ pañcbhirupahārairabhyarcittaṃ kaṭhinacīvaraṃ prasārya pratiṣṭhāpayet /
analyzed: prabhātāyan tu nisāyām samucchrita ātapatra dhvaja patākāḥ diś vidiś vinyasta khaṇḍa piṇḍa dhūpa ghaṭikā ujjvala yaṣṭi pradīpa sugandha gandha ādi divya surabhi kusuma avakīrṇṇe pradeśe khaṭvāyām mañcāyām vā pṛthu pīṭhake mantra adhiṣṭhitam pañcbhiḥ upahāraiḥ abhyarcittam kaṭhina cīvaram prasārya pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: But at dawn, in a well-prepared place strewn with divine fragrant flowers, with parasols, banners, flags, etc. raised, with incense burners and fragrant sticks placed in the cardinal and intermediate directions, with blazing lamps and sweet scents, etc., on a bed or couch or large seat, the patched robe consecrated with mantras and worshipped with the five offerings should be spread out and installed.

original: tad anu tacchrāddho dānapatirudārābhiḥ pūjābhirabhipūjyābhipraṇamya suvarṇṇarajatatāmrādidhātu dravyaṃ marakatapadmarāgavajravaidūryyendranīlādikaṃ ratnaṃ divyāmbarābharaṇādikaṃ ca tasmin kaṭhinacīvare ratnatrayāya dadyāt //
analyzed: tat anu tad śrāddhaḥ dānapatiḥ udārābhiḥ pūjābhiḥ abhipūjya abhipraṇamya suvarṇṇa rajata tāmra ādi dhātu dravyam marakata padmarāga vajra vaidūrya indranīla ādikam ratnam divya ambara ābharaṇa ādikam ca tasmin kaṭhina cīvare ratnatrayāya dadyāt
translated: Then, the faithful patron, having worshipped with extensive offerings, having bowed down, should give to that patched robe gold, silver, copper, and other precious substances, emeralds, rubies, diamonds, lapis lazuli, sapphires, and other jewels, divine garments, ornaments, and so on, for the Three Jewels.

original: kṣetraṃ vādikā ghārāmopavanādikaṃ dāsīdāsahastyaśca gomahiṣyādikaṃ piṇḍakādipratyāyañca bahirddhanantāḍapatrādau tan nāmākam vilikhya tatraiva prayacchet /

translated: Fields, gardens, parks, and so on, female and male servants, elephants, cows, buffaloes, and so on, and the means of livelihood such as almsfood, and other external wealth, having written their names on palm leaves and so on, he should give them there itself.

original: bhakṣyabhojyalehyapeyādikaṃ bhājanādīni pañcopakaraṇabhāṇḍāni śayanāsanādīni bhaiṣajyānyupakaraṇāni cānekānyupabhogārhāṇi vastūni kaṭhinaṃ saṃspṛśya tat pārśvavataḥ saṃghopabhogāya viśrāṇayet /

translated: Edible, drinkable, chewable, and suckable things, the five utensils such as bowls, beds, seats, and so on, medicines, and many other useful things, having touched the patched robe, he should dedicate them to the Sangha for their enjoyment.

analyzed: iti kaṭhinam
translated: Thus, the patched robe.

analyzed: atha āyuṣmān sumanāḥ nāma bhikṣuḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the monk named Venerable Sumana said this to the Blessed One:

original: bhagavan kena kāraṇena cīvarādikaṃ kaṭhinam ityucyate /

translated: Blessed One, for what reason is the robe and so on called 'patched'?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: āyuṣman dṛḍhaṃ viśuddham abhedyaṃ vipulāvināśi ca kaṭhinam ityucyate /
analyzed: āyuṣman dṛḍham viśuddham abhedyam vipula avināśi ca kaṭhinam iti ucyate
translated: Venerable one, it is said to be firm, pure, unbreakable, vast, indestructible, and solid.

original: tathā hi dānapaterāśayasya dṛḍhatvāccivarasya viśuddhatvāt saṃghasyābhedyātvād dānasya phalasya ca vipulāvināśitvācca sarvameva katḥinaṃ bhavati
analyzed: tathā hi dānapateḥ āśayasya dṛḍha tvāt civarasya viśuddha tvāt saṃghasya abhedyā tvāt dānasya phalasya ca vipula avināśi tvāt ca sarvam eva bhavati
translated: Because the intention of the donor is firm, the robe is pure, the Saṅgha is unbreakable, and the fruit of the gift is vast and indestructible, everything becomes solid.

analyzed: śrāvasti puryām naradamya sārathiḥ
translated: In the city of Śrāvastī, the charioteer of human beings,

analyzed: vihṛtya cetohila bandhanāt cyutaḥ
translated: Having dwelt and released the mind from bondage,

analyzed: śānta indriyaḥ ca api upaśānta mānasaḥ
translated: With tranquil faculties and a peaceful mind,

analyzed: nimantrayāmāsa jinaḥ sva śiṣyān
translated: The Victor invited his own disciples.

original: śrāvastyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ jetavane'nāthapiṇḍadasyārāme śubhe surabhidhūpadhūpite sugandhipuṣpakrakaropaśobhite śuciparisare mahārham mahadāsanamāsinaṃ viśuddhabodhiṃ vidhvastasamastadoṣaṃ mahākāruṇikaṃ bhagavantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ śākyamunīndraṃ mahatpariṣadgaṇaiḥ sārdhaṃ viharati sma /
analyzed: śrāvastyām mahā nagaryām jetavanena athapiṇḍadasya ārāme śubhe surabhi dhūpa dhūpite sugandhi puṣpa krakara upaśobhite śuci parisare mahārham mahat āsana māsinam viśuddha bodhim vidhvasta samasta doṣam mahā kāruṇikam bhagavantam samyaksaṃbuddham śākyamuni indram mahat pariṣad gaṇaiḥ sārdham viharati sma
translated: In the Jeta Grove, in the delightful and fragrant garden of Anāthapiṇḍada in the great city of Śrāvastī, perfumed with sweet incense, adorned with fragrant flowers, in a pure and clean place, the Blessed One, the Holy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Shakya Sage, the Lord of Sages, the Great Compassionate One, the One Whose Enlightenment is Pure, the One Who Has Destroyed All Faults, was seated on a great and precious seat, together with a great assembly of followers.

original: atha bhagavān tūṣṇībhāvenāvasthitaḥ san sattvārthaṃ prati daśavidhabuddhakṛtyakaraṇāya laukikaṃ cittam /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tūṣṇībhāvena avasthitaḥ san sattva artham prati daśavidha buddha kṛtya karaṇāya laukikam cittam
translated: Then the Blessed One, remaining in silence, for the sake of beings, for the performance of the ten deeds of a Buddha, [had a worldly thought].

original: tataḥ tīrthikaparivrājakacoditāyāstathāgataṃ prati duṣkṛtaṃ karma saṃsmṛtya saṃjātasaṃvegāḥ sthavirasthavirā bhikṣavaḥ śirasi vinihitāñjalayo mahadāsanāsīnaṃ mahākāruṇikaṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantam praṇipatyedam abrūvan /
analyzed: tatas tīrthika parivrājaka coditāyāḥ tathāgatam prati duṣkṛtam karma saṃsmṛtya saṃjāta saṃvegāḥ sthavira sthavirāḥ bhikṣavaḥ śirasi vinihita añjalayaḥ mahat āsana āsīnam mahā kāruṇikam buddham bhagavantam praṇipatya idam abrūvan
translated: Then, the senior monks, having remembered the evil karma they had committed against the Tathagata, urged on by the non-Buddhist ascetics, feeling remorse, bowed down to the feet of the compassionate Buddha, the Blessed One, seated on a great seat, and said this:

original: kṛtā bhagavatānekā dharmādhikārikī kathā vyākṛtāścāneke sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: kṛtā bhagavatā anekā dharma ādhikārikī kathā vyākṛtāḥ ca aneke sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: O Blessed One, you have spoken many discourses on the Dharma, and many beings have been prophesied to attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: anyaccānekam buddhakṛtyaṃ kṛtam asmābhirapi prathamaṃ bodhicittamutpāditam aneke ca samyaksambuddhāḥ paryupāsitāḥ /
analyzed: anyat ca anekam buddha kṛtyam kṛtam asmābhiḥ api prathamam bodhi cittam utpāditam aneke ca samyaksambuddhāḥ paryupāsitāḥ
translated: You have performed many other deeds of a Buddha, and we have also generated the mind of enlightenment for the first time, and have attended upon many perfectly enlightened Buddhas.

original: yannu vayam anavataptaṃ saro gatvā bhagavataḥ purastāt svakasvakāṃ karmoplotiṃ vyākurmaḥ /
analyzed: yat nu vayam anavataptam saraḥ gatvā bhagavataḥ purastāt svaka svakām karma uplotim vyākurmaḥ
translated: Now, let us go to the Anavatapta lake and confess our individual karmic obscurations in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: adhivāsayatu bhagavān iti
translated: May the Blessed One grant us permission.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jīvatāṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ dhriyamāṇānāṃ yāpayatāṃ daśāvaśyakaraṇīyāni bhavanti //
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām jīvatām tiṣṭhatām dhriyamāṇānām yāpayatām daśa avaśya karaṇīyāni bhavanti
translated: It is the nature of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, that while they are living, abiding, and enduring, there are ten things that must be done.

analyzed: katamāni daśa
translated: What are the ten?

analyzed: na tāvat buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvānti
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not attain final nirvāṇa

analyzed: yāvat na buddham vyākurvanti
translated: until they proclaim the Buddha's prediction.

original: yāvad anekena sattvenānuttarāyaṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ notpāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat anekena sattvena anuttarāyam samyaksaṃbodhau cittam na utpāditam bhavati
translated: Until many beings have generated the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: yāvat na sarve vineyāḥ vinītāḥ bhavanti
translated: Until all disciples have been disciplined.

analyzed: yāvat śrāvaka yugam agra tāyām na nirdiṣṭam bhavati
translated: Until the foremost pair of disciples has been designated.

analyzed: yāvat na sīmābandhaḥ kṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: Until the boundary has been established.

analyzed: yāvat na āyuṣaḥ pañcamaḥ bhāgaḥ utsṛṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: Until the fifth part of the lifespan has been relinquished.

original: yavanna śrāvastyām mahānagaryāṃ mahāprātihāryaṃ darśitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yavan na śrāvastyām mahā nagaryām mahā prātihāryam darśitam bhavati
translated: Until the great miracle has been shown in the great city of Śrāvastī.

original: yaāvanna śāṃkāśye nagare devāvatāraṃ darśitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: śāṃkāśye nagare deva avatāram darśitam bhavati
translated: Until the descent from the gods has been shown in the city of Śāketa.

analyzed: yāvat na mātā pitarau satyeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitau bhavataḥ
translated: Until the mother and father have been established in the truths.

original: yāvadanavatapte mahāsarasi pūrvikā karmaplotiḥ śrāvakasaṅghena sārdhaṃ na vyākṛtā bhavatīti /
analyzed: yāvat anavatapte mahā sarasi pūrvikā karma plotiḥ śrāvaka saṅghena sārdham na vyākṛtā bhavati iti
translated: Until the previous karma of the great lake Anavatapta was explained together with the assembly of disciples.

original: atha bhagavatā manasi kṛtvā śrāvakasaṃghena sārdhaṃ vyākṛtā bhavatīti /
analyzed: atha bhagavatā manasi kṛtvā śrāvaka saṃghena sārdham vyākṛtā bhavati iti
translated: Then, when it was explained by the Blessed One after keeping it in mind together with the assembly of disciples,
